faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about our services and work process.

items.question: How long does it take to develop an application?
items.answer: The development time varies depending on the complexity of the project. A MVP can take between 2 and 3 months, while more complex applications can take 4 to 6 months or more. During the discovery phase, we provide a detailed schedule specific to your project.

items.question: What technologies do you use?
items.answer: We work with a wide range of modern technologies, including React, React Native, Node.js, Next.js, TypeScript, Python, and various database solutions. We choose the most suitable technological stack for each project, considering specific requirements, scalability, and long-term maintenance.

items.question: How does the budgeting process work?
items.answer: Our budgeting process starts with a free consultation to understand your project. Next, we perform a requirements analysis and prepare a detailed proposal with scope, timeline, and investment. We work with fixed-price models for well-defined projects or time & materials for more flexible projects.

items.question: Do you offer support after launch?
items.answer: Yes, we offer various support plans and post-launch maintenance. These include bug fixes, security updates, performance improvements, and the implementation of new features. We can customize a support plan to meet your specific business needs.

items.question: Is it possible to make changes during development?
items.answer: Yes, our agile methodology allows flexibility for adjustments during development. We work in short cycles (sprints) and perform regular reviews, allowing you to provide feedback and request adjustments throughout the process. Significant changes in scope can impact timelines and costs, but we always discuss this transparently.

items.question: Do you sign confidentiality agreements (NDAs)?
items.answer: Absolutely. We respect the confidentiality of your ideas and information. We are always willing to sign confidentiality agreements (NDAs) before discussing the details of your project. Trust and information security are fundamental to our relationship with clients.
